org.jetel.data.formatter

Class CloverDataFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.formatter.AbstractFormatter
      • org.jetel.data.formatter.CloverDataFormatter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, Formatter

    public class CloverDataFormatter
extends AbstractFormatter
    Class for saving data in Clover internal format.
    Since:
    Oct 12, 2006

    • Field Detail

      • CLOVER_DATA_HEADER

        public static final long CLOVER_DATA_HEADER
        This long value is used as a header for internal clover binary data sources/targets. CloverDataReader and CloverDataWriter components are dedicated to work with this data format. Each clover data source (since 2.9 version) starts with this value and follows with compatibility value @see CLOVER_DATA_COMPATIBILITY_HASH, one byte for major version number, one byte for minor version number, one byte for revision number, and other four bytes for various options. NOTE: cannot be changed from defaultProperties file
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLOVER_DATA_COMPATIBILITY_HASH_2_9

        public static final long CLOVER_DATA_COMPATIBILITY_HASH_2_9
        This long value is used for decision about inter-version compatibility of clover binary format. Need to be changed whenever clover engine changed way how to data records are serialized. NOTE: cannot be changed from defaultProperties file
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getPreferredDataTargetType

        public Formatter.DataTargetType getPreferredDataTargetType()
        Description copied from interface: Formatter
        Formatter can request specific data target type, which is preferred to be passed into Formatter.setDataTarget(Object) method. This is intended just a hint for source provider, so other types of data targets should be expected.
        Specified by:
        getPreferredDataTargetType in interface Formatter
        Overrides:
        getPreferredDataTargetType in class AbstractFormatter

      • finish

        public void finish()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Formatter
        This method writes all data (header, body, footer) which are to write, but doesn't close underlying streams. TODO remove this method, Formatter.flush() is good enough, see CL-2196
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
